results.title: Zulu
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Joseph E. Levine, Diamond Films, Sir Stanley Baker and Cy Endfield
results.brief_description: One of the most popular British films of the 1960’s, “Zulu” is based on the true story of the defence of Rorke’s Drift in 1879. In this battle, 1200 men of the South Wales Borderers confronted four thousand attacking Zulu warriors. A stunning, historically accurate, battle picture starring the great British actors Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins and Michael Caine in his first screen role. A movie of “epic” proportions, the long and bloody battle is depicted in meticulous detail. The Zulus, who had never seen a motion picture, were shown an old Roy Rogers western to assist their performance. The Zulu chief is played by the real-life Chief Buthelezzi.

results.title: Zorba the Greek
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Michael Cacoyannis
results.brief_description: After inheriting a mine in Crete, a young English writer (Alan Bates) goes to the Mediterranean island to inspect his property. There he meets Alexis Zorba (Anthony Quinn), a gregarious Greek who persuades Basil that he can help him re-establish the mine. Their encounters with the village community, including an ageing French coquette Hortense (Lila Kedrova) and a beautiful widow (Irene Papas), are by turns amusing and horrifying. Based on the novel by Nikos Kazantzakis.

results.title: Zoolander [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Village Roadshow Pictures, Paramount Pictures, VH1 Films, Stuart Cornfeld, Scott Rudin and Ben Stiller
results.brief_description: Ben Stiller directed, co-wrote and starred in this comedy, which spoofs the world of male models. The idea, which began as a Stiller skit in 1996, is teased into a feature length film. The story centres on Derek Zoolander (Stiller) - a famous male model, three-time winner of model of the year and creator of several iconic looks including Le Tigre and Blue steel. Derek’s reign is threatened by the rise of Hansel McDonald (Owen Wilson) a male model whose freewheeling attitude makes him hotter than the 90s flavoured Derek. The plot centres on rivalry between the two models and the assassination of the Malaysian Prime Minister, whose new anti-child labour laws threatens the lucrative fashion trade. “Zoolander” satirises modelling, beauty, the cult of celebrity, nightclubs, MTV and VH1 type of fashion awards. One of the sharpest sequences in the film is a ‘walk-off’ between the two models, judged by none other than David Bowie. Numerous film references are peppered throughout including - 2001: A Space odyssey, the X-Files, the Manchurian candidate and Trading places. Cast includes: Jerry Stiller, David Duchovny, Vince Vaughn, Christine Taylor and Will Ferrell, with cameos by Billy Zane, Wynona Ryder, Donald Trump, Christina Slater, Lenny Kravitz, Gwen Stefani and Donatella Versace.

results.title: Z00 = A Zed and Two Noughts
results.creator_credit: Artificial Eye, Peter Sainsbury and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description: A bizarre meditation on the processes of life, death and decay, by that stylist of the off-beat and the grotesque, Peter Greenaway. Starring Joss Ackland, Brian Deacon, Eric Deacon, and Andrea Ferreol. “Very funny…very bizarre…beautiful, clever, dazzling.”

results.title: Yvonne's perfume = Le Parfum d'Yvonne [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Lambart Productions, Zoulou Films, Centre European Cinematographique Rhones-Alpes, M.G. Films, Thierry Ganay and Patrice Leconte
results.brief_description: 1958, a resort hotel on Lake Geneva is the setting for this foray into romance, friendship and decadence. It is at the hotel that Victor meets Dr. Meinthe, a flamboyant homosexual, and Yvonne, a beautiful woman who captures them both. Together, the three of them embark on a summer experience like no other. Cast includes Jean-Pierre Marielle, Hippolyte Girardot and Sandra Majani. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Your friends and neighbors
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Steve Golin, Jason Patric and Neil LaBute
results.brief_description: Neil Labute’s (“In the company of men”, “Nurse Betty”) second feature is a caustic, bleak study of sexual dysfunction and alienation amongst six casually connected friends and lovers. Labute’s brittle screenplay wanders between one relationship horror show to another as these hapless ‘friends and neighbours’ try to connect with each other through a series of empty sexual encounters and misguided affairs. Terri (Catherine Keener) can’t stand the fact that her husband Jerri (Ben Stiller) makes a lot of noise when they make love. Terri starts an affair with Cheri (Nastassja Kinski), a sensitive art gallery curator who’s neediness and insecurity requires constant validation. Jerri on the other hand finds himself infatuated with Mary (Amy Brenneman), his best friends wife. Mary’s husband Barry (Aaron Eckhart) claims the best sex he has ever had is with himself and is frustrated by his wife’s lack of sex drive. All the while Barry and Jerri’s predatory and narcissistic single friend Cary (Jason Patric) dishes out his own brand of misogynous rough justice with the countless women he sleeps with.

results.title: Young Winston
results.creator_credit: Open Road Films, Columbia Pictures, Carl Foreman and Richard Attenborough
results.brief_description: This historical drama about British leader Winston Churchill, one of the 20th century’s great public figures, is based on his autobiography “My Early Life”. It chronicles his tumultuous rise to power from childhood to the age of twenty-six, when he delivered his first speech in the House of Commons covering his time as a war correspondent in India, his involvement in Kitchener’s Sudan expedition, and his capture and escape during the Boer War in South Africa. While it glosses over some of the less savory aspects of Churchill’s character, it nevertheless reveals him as a complex and very private man. The cast includes many esteemed British actors such as Robert Shaw, Ian Holm, Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Edward Woodward and John Mills. Churchill’s mother was played by Anne Bancroft.

results.title: Young guns II (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Morgan Creek, Paul Schiff, Irby Smith and Geoff Murphy
results.brief_description: Hollywood’s most wanted men return in a blaze of glory to shake the west once again. Down, but definitely not out, the three surviving members of the infamous Regulators, Billy the Kid, (Emilio Estevez), Josiah ‘Doc’ Scurlock, (Kiefer Sutherland), and Chavez Y. Chavez, (Lou Diamond Phillips), reunite for their greatest adventure. Joined by his pal Arkansas Dave Rudabaugh, (Christian Slater), and two unlikely recruits, Billy is as reckless and irreverent as ever as he rounds up his new gang and heads for the west. But things have changed since the Regulators last rode through. The Kid is cornered by ruthless cattle kings and double-crossed by corrupt officials. Tracked by his one-time friend - the newly appointed sheriff, Pat Garrett - the Kid leads the Regulators down a treacherous trail towards Old Mexico… and to their destiny.

results.title: Young Einstein (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Serious Productions, Warwick Ross, David Roach and Yahoo Serious
results.brief_description: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock ‘n roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock ‘n roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.
